Title: Getting Started with QR-Based Restaurant Management System API

Nodes.Text: API for browsing menu items and placing orders in a QR-based restaurant system.
Requirements

The SDK relies on **Node.js** and **npm** (to resolve dependencies). It also requires **Typescript version >=4.1**. You can download and install Node.js and [npm](https://www.npmjs.com/) from [the official Node.js website](https://nodejs.org/en/download/).
> **NOTE:** npm is installed by default when Node.js is installed.
Verify Successful Installation
Run the following commands in the command prompt or shell of your choice to check if Node.js and npm are successfully installed:
* Node.js: `node --version`
* npm: `npm --version`
Install Dependencies
- To resolve all dependencies, go to the **SDK root directory** and run the following command with npm:

```bash
npm install
```
- This will install all dependencies in the **node_modules** folder.
The following section explains how to use the generated library in a new project.
- Open an IDE/text editor for JavaScript like Visual Studio Code. The basic workflow presented here is also applicable if you prefer using a different editor or IDE.
- Click on **File** and select **Open Folder**. Select an empty folder of your project, the folder will become visible in the sidebar on the left.
- To initialize the Node project, click on **Terminal** and select **New Terminal**. Execute the following command in the terminal:

```bash
npm init --y
```

- The created project manages its dependencies using its `package.json` file. In order to add a dependency on the *QR-Based Restaurant Management System APILib* client library, double click on the ``` package.json ``` file in the bar on the left and add the dependency to the package in it.
- To install the package in the project, run the following command in the terminal:

```bash
npm install
```

Steps.Title: Add Dependencies to the Client Library

The API client can be initialized as follows:

This API uses the following authentication schemes.
* [`bearerAuth (OAuth 2 Bearer token)`]($h/__auth_BearerAuth)
Documentation for accessing and setting credentials for bearerAuth.

Data: The OAuth 2.0 Access Token to use for API requests.

Nodes.Text: **Note:** Auth credentials can be set using `bearerAuthCredentials` object in the client.
You must provide credentials in the client as shown in the following code snippet.
This page can contain Tutorials/Guides/Changelogs or any information that API providers want to expose to their users besides what is auto-generated by Apimatic.

* [Menu]($e/Menu)
* [Order]($e/Order)
Endpoints for browsing menu items
The instance of the `MenuApi` class can be created using the API Client.
const menuApi = new MenuApi(client);

Nodes.Title: List Menu Items
Nodes.Name: listMenuItems
Nodes.Description: Returns the full list of menu items currently available for ordering.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `result` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```MenuResponse```]($m/MenuResponse).

ReturnTypeExample.Text:
{
  "success": true,
  "count": 2,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0001",
      "name": "Margherita Pizza",
      "description": "Classic pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil",
      "price": 1199.0,
      "category": "Pizza",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/margherita.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    },
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0002",
      "name": "Chicken Biryani",
      "description": "Spiced rice with marinated chicken",
      "price": 899.0,
      "category": "Main",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/biryani.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    }
  ]
}

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"GET","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/menu{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json"{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"none"}}

Response.Name: response200
Response.Description:
List of menu items

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `result` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```MenuResponse```]($m/MenuResponse).

{
  "success": true,
  "count": 2,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0001",

      "price": 1199.0,

    },

Nodes.Text: Endpoints for creating and viewing orders
The instance of the `OrderApi` class can be created using the API Client.
const orderApi = new OrderApi(client);

Nodes.Title: Place Order
Nodes.Name: placeOrder
Nodes.Description: Creates an order for the specified items and table.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `result` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderResponse```]($m/OrderResponse).

MethodSignature.Text:
async placeOrder(
  body: OrderInput,
  requestOptions?: RequestOptions
): Promise<ApiResponse<OrderResponse>>

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Order payload including items, table number, and customer details.

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"POST","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/order/place-order{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json","Content-Type":"application/json"{% if auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] != nil %},"Authorization":{{ auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] | prepend: 'Bearer ' | json: false }}{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"json","data":{% if call["args"]["body"] != nil %}{{ call["args"]["body"] | unwrap_add_props | json: false }}{% else %}null{% endif %}}}

Response.Name: response201
Response.Description:
Order placed successfully

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `result` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderResponse```]($m/OrderResponse).

Headers.Name: Location
Headers.Description: URL of the created order resource

Nodes.Title: Get Order History
Nodes.Name: getOrderHistory
Nodes.Description: Returns the authenticated user's recent orders.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `result` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderHistoryResponse```]($m/OrderHistoryResponse).

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"GET","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/order/history{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json"{% if auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] != nil %},"Authorization":{{ auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] | prepend: 'Bearer ' | json: false }}{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"none"}}

Response.Name: response200
Response.Description:
List of previous orders

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `result` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderHistoryResponse```]($m/OrderHistoryResponse).

Nodes.Text: Represents the HTTP client configurations for API calls.
Properties

Data: Custom http agent to be used when performing http requests.
Custom https agent to be used when performing http requests.
Proxy server configurations to route both HTTP and HTTPS requests through a proxy.

Nodes.Text: Represents the retry configurations for API calls.
Properties

Data:
Whether to retry on request timeout.
*Default*: `true`

Interval before next retry. Used in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
*Default*: `1`

Overall wait time for the requests getting retried.
*Default*: `0`

Used in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
*Default*: `2`

Nodes.Text: Represents the proxy server configurations for API calls.
Properties

Data: The port to connect to the proxy server.

Nodes.Text: ProxyAuth
Client Initialization with Proxy Configuration
To configure the SDK to use a proxy server, initialize the proxy configuration during client setup as shown in the Usage Example.

Nodes.Text: Represents the logging configurations for API calls.
Properties
Represents the request logging configurations for API calls.
Properties

Data:
Array of headers which values are non-senstive to display in logging.
*Default*: `[]`

Nodes.Text: Represents the request logging configurations for API calls.
Properties

Data:
Response Headers to include in logging
*Default*: `[]`

Response Headers to exclude in logging
*Default*: `[]`

Array of headers which values are non-senstive to display in logging.
*Default*: `[]`

Nodes.Text: An interface for custom logger implementation.
Logger Methods

Data: Logs a message with a specified log level and additional parameters.

1. level: The log level of the message.
2. message: The message template to log.
3. params: The parameters to include in the log message.
log(level: LogLevel, message: string, params: Record<string, any>): void

Nodes.Text: Usage Example
Custom LoggerInterface implementation

In order to provide custom logger, any implementation of the `LoggerInterface` can be used so that you can override the `log` behavior and provide its instance directly in the SDK client initialization. The following example exports a `WinstonLogger` class that implements the `LoggerInterface`'s `log()` function.
Client Initialization with Custom Logger
The following example uses the above `WinstonLogger` implementation of `LoggerInterface` for QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi Client initialization.

Nodes.Text:
Thrown when the HTTP status code is not okay.

The ApiError extends the ApiResponse interface, so all ApiResponse properties are available.
Properties

Data: Original request that resulted in this response.
